item.title: Blame
item.description: Blame is the act of holding others responsible by making negative statements regarding their actions. It is the opposite of praise.

item.title: Coordination Problem
item.description: Problems that occur when everyone tried to do what is best locally, but causes global problems. Common example: if everyone fishes a common pool, they will kill off the fish.

item.title: Molloc
item.description: The Idiot God of Human Groups In an almost spiritual sense, Molloc is the one we blame when a group of humans begins to act in inhumane ways.

item.title: Normal is who you meet
item.description: “Normal is who you meet” means that a person’s concept of normality is determined by the amount of variety in their experiences.
